chapter.title: Registering the redBorder Enterprise Edition IPS

section.title: Basic Configuration
section.para: Upon completing the installation process, you have two configuration options depending on whether or not there is a DHCP server.

listitem.para: Dynamic IP (DHCP): in this case, redBorder will have acquired an IP in its network interface.
Static IP: in this case redborder will not have any IP assigned.

section.para: In both cases you will have to access the system in order to configure and register the sensor in the manager. You will access with the root user and password that was selected during installation.
Once inside the system you will start the configuration manager. To do this, you will execute:
A menu with different options will appear:
Once execute rb_sysconf you will access the redborder configuration menu.
There are 5 options:

listitem.para: System Configuration: here you can define and modify basic settings such as hostname, date, time, etc.
Network Configuration: this is the option where you can configure the network settings.
Passwords: access this option if you need to change your credentials.
Update rules from Manager: select this option to force a rule update from the Manager (optional).
quit: exit.

section.title: Network configuration
section.para: IDS/IPS sensors need to comunicate with the el Manager, to make this possible some network configuration is needed. Select option 2) Network Configuration from the redborder configuration menu.
Until this setting is not made properly, the sensor will not be able to be registered in the Manager.
Those are the steps you need to follow to network configure your sensor:

listitem.para: Managagement network configuration:
a) Make a bonding and assign management interface.
b) Segments configuration.
Doman and DNS configuration

note.title: Note
note.para: The order to configure the management network can be different. The order described on this manual is considered to be the more optimal one.

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: In case the system is install in a machine with multiples network interfaces, the user need to select the one that will be the management bonding.

section.title: Interface asignement and bonding creation
section.para: Select Network Configuration typing option 2 y press Enter.
In case the system detect bypass interfaces, the will be added automaticaly as segments.
To configure the network configuration correclty:

listitem.para: Bonding creation: (4 bonds max).
Selection and assigment of bonding ports.
Managmenet network interfaces selections for the bondings.

section.para: The system will show a detailled list that will help the administrator to decide which ports are available to bonding creation.

note.title: Note
note.para: To select the default parameters press: Enter

section.title: Creation of a new bonding and port assignments
section.para: To show t his process we will create a bonding (bond0) with 2 ports.
Select option n from the right lateral submenu.
All available ports will be shown, select the one that you want to be part of the bonding.
Introduce port number in Insert bonding first port [0]:
The number between the brackets [] is the one that the system defined by default. To selectt this number press Enter.
The selected port will disappear from the list of available ports.

important.title: Important
important.para: The system only allows a maximum of 4 bonds: (0-3).

section.title: Add an extra bonding port
section.para: The sytem will ask: Insert second port (y/N)
The default option is the opne with uppercase. Remember that if you dont need to add a new port you only need to press Enter.
In case you want to add an extra port press y.

textobject.phrase: Add new port to the bonding

caption.para: Add new port to the bonding

section.para: Insert the port number Insert bonding second port [1]:
The number between brackets [] is the default setting. To select this number just press Enter.

section.title: Bonding network configuration
section.para: Once the assigment of the second port is made on the new bonding (bond0), the system will ask the following:

listitem.para: IP Address
Network mask
Gateway
Routes

section.para: If your device uses DHCP, an IP address will be assign by default. Press Enter to select the IP, network mask and gateway assign by the system. In other case, enter manually those values.
The system also add default routes for the new bonding.
To insert a manual route, select option y in Insert a route for this bonding (y/N)?:

caption.para: Add a manual route to the bonding

section.para: Once this process is finish, a message will appear: Bonding 0 created successfully.

section.title: Finish bonding creation process
section.para: Befor apply the changes and finish the bonding creation process the system will show a table with the new bonding (bond0) next to the used ports, IP, network mask and routes.
To save the setings, you should apply the changes selection the option a.
You can delte in any moment the bond or bonds made selecting option delete bonding pressing the key d.
To go back to the main menu, select option quit pressing q.

section.title: Domain and DNS configuration
section.para: On the network menu configuration we can find this option DNS and domain settings. To start the process, select option2.
In order to configure this correctly the user will need to introduce:

listitem.para: Domain name
Primary DNS address
Secondary DNS address (opcional)

section.para: Once the values are set, the system will show a message telling the configuration was made successfully.
To end this process, no apply changes is needed, select option quit pressing q to go back to the main network menu.

section.title: Segments configuration
section.para: Select option Segment settings pressing the number 3.
This screen will show the current number of segments, ports of each segment and if they support bypass.
On this section you will find the folling submenu:

listitem.para: f) force bypass autoassign:to foce automaticaly bypass port assigment.
n) new segment:selection this option to make a new segment.
d) delete segment:to delete one segment.
q) quit:exit.

section.para: To make a new segmenet select n) new segment.
This process include the following actions:

listitem.para: Assigment of bypass interfaces to the segments (opcional).
Creation of one segmenet: (max 16 segments).
Select and assign ports to a segment.

section.para: In order to select a port, a detaill list will be shown, this will help the adminsitator to decided which ports will be use by the segments.

section.title: Bypass interfaces selection
section.para: When the system detects bypass interfaces, it will be added automacticaly after access the network configuration menu.
There are also two extra ways assign a port:

listitem.para: Force bypass autoassign: sellect option Force bypass auto assign on the segment configuration menu pressing f.
Manual assigment: select bypass ports from the list of available ports.

section.title: Creation of a new segment
section.para: As an example we are gonna make a segment (segment 0) and will be assign 2 ports.
To begin the process select option n that appears in the right submenu.
Once you have check all available ports, select the one that you wan to include in the segment.
Introduce the segment number on Insert segment number (0-15) [0]:
Th number between brackets [] is the default one. To select this number just press Enter.
The previous assig port will disappear from the list of available ports.

note.title: Note
note.para: The system only allow a maximum of 16 segments (0-15).

section.title: Add a second port to the segment
section.para: Once assign the first port to the segment, the system will ask for a second one: Assign second port to the segment (Y/n):
By default the option is the one in uppercase.
Remember if you want to assign a new port you only need to press Enter.
In another case just press n. Select an available port from the list.
Enter the number of the port on Insert segment second port [3]:

caption.para: Assign new port to the segment

section.para: Once the ports were assign to a segment, the system will show a message: Segment 0 created successfully.

section.title: Finish the segment creation process
section.para: Before applying the changes and finish the process, the system will show the settings:

listitem.para: Segments
Assigned ports
Bypass support

section.para: To save the settings press a.
You can delete in any moment the created segments by selection delete segment, pressing d.
To go back to the main network configuration menu select quit by pressing q.

caption.para: Apply changes to finish segment creation process

section.title: Manager sensor registration
section.para: To finish the installation process of the IPS/IDS sensors the last step consist in Manager sensors registration.
In the sensor registration menu we can find the following options:

listitem.para: Hostname [rbsensor]: assign a sensor name.
Set local time: configure local time.
IP adress for rB Master Manager [127.0.0.1]: introduce the Manager IP.
Register rB: register the sensor into the Manager.

section.title: Assign sensor name (Hostname)
section.para: Select the option Hostname [rbsensor] from the registration menu pressing 1.
Next, on the line Insert Hostname [rbsensor]: type the name you which for your sensor. This name will be appear in the the web on the sensor list.

note.title: Note
note.para: Remember to use a good name and avoid generic names like “Sensor”.

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: The system will ask you to verify the sensor name, in that case press Enter
If you want to make a modification press n
The system will change the sensor name. To continue and go back the to the main systm menu press any key Press a key to continue...

section.title: Local time configuration
section.para: Select option 2) Set local time.
Insert date and time of your country.
The system will show the support format:

listitem.para: [HH:mm] ó [YYYY/MM/DD]

section.para: Press Enter to continue with the registration process.

caption.para: Sensor registration in the Manager: Select local time

section.title: Introduce Master Manager IP
section.para: Select option 3) IP adress for rB Master Manager [.*].
Type the IP address or domain name of the Manager. The system will check if the Manager can be reached. This process may take a few seconds.
The system will sincronize the time of the machines and then it will reboot some time related services.
Congratulations! Your machine is ready to make the registration with the Manager.
To continue and go back to the system configuration menu press any key Press a key to continue...

section.title: Sensor registration
section.para: This is the last step to configure your redborder IPS/IDS sensor.
From now on you will be able to manage your IPS/IDS sensor from the main application and visualize in a graphic way all the generated events using dashboards.
With this application you will be able to create reports, visualize events and configure some rules to take actions.

para.emphasis: Finish registration process in the Manager

section.para: To complete the registration process follow these steps:

listitem.para: Show debug output: the system will ask Would you like to have a debug output? Select default option (No) pressing the key N.
Insert password: type the password that you use in the Manager basic configuration phase.
Temporal syncronization (automaticaly) between the Manager and its sensors: this process may take some seconds.

section.para: After these steps the system will show a successfully registation message.

para.literal: Sensor registered succesfully with chef server

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: Do not change the sensor name or hostname once is registered. If you want to make those changes you will need to undo the registration process and start over.

section.para: To continue and go back to the system configuration menu press any key Press a key to continue...
In the sensor registration menu you can verify that the sensor was register successfully:(Registered).
To exit, select option quit pressing q.
